result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel Gaytan Sandoval was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).
  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence credit for 245 days were granted.
Concurrent with: Count 10.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $3,978.20 to be paid to Laura M. as a condition of extended supervision.

Extradition costs to be paid to Waukesha County District Attorney's Office as a condition of extended supervision.
Costs and DNA Surcharge waived.

No contact with Merbeth Metal Products Inc. and coactors listed in complaint.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Transcript of sentencing hearing 05-01-2017

Defendant Joel  Gaytan Sandoval in court, in custody, with attorney John Paul Marchan.   Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dawn Maldonado appeared as interpreter. Sworn in. Court addresses presentence investigation filed. Atty. Marchan addresses error in report. State addresses seperate error in report. Court previously found the defendant guilty of Count #9 and #10. State makes recommendations. Atty. Marchan makes statements. Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following: Count #9

Imposed Sentence of:

39 Months Imprisonment (Credit - 245 days). Concurrent to Count #10.
-	15 Months of Initial Confinement
-	24 Months of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:

-No contact with Merbeth Metal Products Inc and coactors listed in complaint .

Restitution: $3978.20 to be paid to Laura M. as a condition of extended supervision

Extradition Costs: $400.00 to be paid to Waukesha County District Attorney's Office to be paid as a condition of extended supervision

COSTS:  WAIVED

DNA Surcharge: WAIVED

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  

**********************************************

The Court Orders the Following: Count #10

Imposed Sentence of:

39 Months Imprisonment (Credit - 245 days). Concurrent to Count #9.
-	15 Months of Initial Confinement
-	24 Months of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:

-No contact with Merbeth Metal Products Inc listed and coactors listed in complaint .

COSTS:  WAIVED

DNA Surcharge: WAIVED

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on May 1, 2017 at 10:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Joel  Gaytan Sandoval in court, in custody, with attorney John Paul Marchan.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Dawn Maldonado appeared as interpreter.
